wikipedia_page.main: Sir Albert Abdullah David Sassoon, 1st Baronet , (25 July 1818 – 24 October 1896) was a British Baghdadi Jewish businessman and philanthropist.

response: A member of the Sassoon family, he was born on 20 June 1856 in Bombay, India. He was the son of Hannah Moise and Albert Abdullah David Sassoon (1818–1896). He graduated from the University of London. He served as a major in the Middlesex Yeomanry (Duke of Cambridge's Hussars).
*Sir Albert Abdullah David Sassoon, 1st Baronet (25 July 1818 – 24 October 1896), father of

link_mentions.page: List of British Jewish nobility and gentry

response: Two large mausoleums of very similar design contain the remains of Sir Jacob Sassoon (1844–1916) and his wife, Rachel Sassoon. A third mausoleum is that of  Sir Albert Abdullah David Sassoon, 1st Baronet (1818–1896), who in the event was buried in England.
